channel.title: The foreach Statement :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: The foreach Statement C# provides a foreach statement that is often useful for iterating through the elements of certain data structures. A foreach can be used when all of the following conditions hold: The data structure is a subtype of either IEnumerable or IEnumerable<T> for some type T. You do not need to know the locations in the data structure of the individual elements. You do not need to modify the data structure with this loop.
